item.title: Hugo HTML Canvas Support
item.description:
This post walks through how to add an HTML Canvas to a Hugo site, with additional guidance on including external JavaScript libraries from a CDN, such as Three.js to render the cube shown below:

Hugo Shortcodes

Adding support to a new HTML DOM in your Hugo site is possible using Hugo shortcodes. Which is a way to add custom HTML elements to your website like image, video, and HTML canvas. The shortcode is a HTML template invoked within markup, accepting any number of arguments.

item.title: Hugo TeX Support
item.description:
We can use the KaTeX library to enable TeX support to your hugo website. The library supports all major browsers. Which TeX we can express math formulas and science symbols with a clear and unambiguous way.

$$ \int_a^b f(x) dx $$

Installing

To install, we just need to import the library files from some CDN to our Hugo website. One way to do this is using the Hugo partials which allow us to import small HTML context.

item.title: Hugo
item.description:
Hugo is a static site generator developed in Go. You write content using plain markdown files, and Hugo build the website following a template defined by you (or by some theme from the Internet).

Inside each template file, you have access to the Hugo's template language that allow you to structure the markdown content over the HTML structure.

Installing Hugo

In macOS, you can install Hugo using Homebrew.

brew update
brew install hugo
